question: 嬉々
sourceMnemonic:
You're so <kanji>glad</kanji>, you get <kanji>glad</kanji> again. Wow, you're just <vocabulary>happily</vocabulary> going through life, aren't you? <vocabulary>Joyfully</vocabulary> accept that gladness into your life!

This word is pretty old, and it's used like a noun with <ja>と</ja>(<ja>して</ja>) added to make it an adverb or <ja>たる</ja> added to make it an adjective. Make sure to check out the context sentences to get more familiar with this classical word.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This word uses on'yomi readings of the kanji you learned... twice! You should be able to read this on your own.
